file_content.text: So, here you are. A little later than I was expecting, to be honest.
Did it really take you that long to wipe out Zardres and his men? Maybe you're not as good as I'd thought you were.
If you throw down your weapons, I'll bring you in alive.
Surrender. Now.
Not a chance.
Sorry--there's just so much to see and do on Nar Shaddaa.
I took the scenic route.
Idiot. If you'd gotten here sooner, you might've actually had a chance.
The Imps told me exactly where to find you, Andrik. Maybe you should've been more polite.
Zardres sold you out.
Cowards. I should've expected as much.
I butchered them, just like I'm going to butcher you.
Don't get your hopes up.
I'm sure you're really looking forward to it.
You make me sick. You killed good men--fellow soldiers! All because some scumbag on Coruscant said they were traitors?
Your loyalties are all wrong. When you're bleeding out in a trench on some muckball planet, it ain't High Command that pulls you out--it's the guy next to you.
We can work this out, Andrik. Just lower your weapon and we'll talk.
Go ahead, keep talking.
I'm not interested in working anything out with scum like you.
You've betrayed the Republic. It doesn't matter why.
Treason is treason.
Blind. Blind and stupid. I'll bet you can't even imagine doing something you weren't ordered to do.
It wasn't High Command that ambushed me on Ord Mantell--it was the guy next to me. Tavus.
You're full of it.
Tavus probably saw what I see--a worthless, brainwashed slave. Not worth keeping around.
Treacherous vermin, I have completed the charging process. All systems operable.
Sounds like your time's up, Lieutenant. Have any last--
Lieutenant! You made it. I knew this Imp-loving scum could never escape the sure justice of the Republic for long.
Are you still forced to follow Andrik's commands?
Can you help me?
At least now you know whose side you've been working for.
Glad you've seen the truth.
Yes. Without your timely intervention, I might never have realized the truth.
Kill Captain Andrik and his followers! Immediately!
Droid! Obey me!
I would like nothing more, Lieutenant.
Unfortunately, I am still bound by my programming to obey Captain Andrik. The coward has naturally ordered me to kill you.
To be used this way against the finest agents of my beloved Republic shames me. I wish I had never been activated.
You never chose to be a traitor.
It's not your fault.
Whether by choice or not, I am acting as a traitor--worthy only of scorn and summary obliteration.
If you know that your orders are treasonous, why do you have to follow them?
Can't you ignore your orders?
It is in my programming. The Republic's brilliant scientists clearly had no reason to expect such sedition.
That definitely would've saved me a lot of trouble.
So do I.
Enough chatter. It's time to finish this.
Lieutenant, be advised that your weapon will require several decades of sustained fire in order to penetrate my shields at their current charge.
Seeing as Republic SpecForce training is the best in the galaxy, I'm confident you'll find an alternative solution for my destruction. Good luck.
I appreciate the tip, Forex.
Um... thanks?
It is my pleasure to at least serve the Republic in this small way.
Don't worry, Forex. You won't have to put up with this much longer.
I'll try to make this quick.
That's a great relief, Lieutenant.
Enough! Open fire!
Why don't I just kill Andrik and his pals while I think about it?
I'll be fine.
Go ahead and try. Open fire!
We're wasting time. There is an entire galaxy full of depraved lunatics plotting against our great Republic, and we're busy rummaging for valuables!
Be patient, Forex--black ops aren't cheap. Commander Tavus needs us to be resourceful.
But I've been operational for days, now--Imperial vermin across the galaxy should be cursing the Republic ingenuity that created me!
Nobody move a muscle! Keep your hands where I can see them!
Freeze!
You know you're not actually serving the Republic here, right?
You do know you're traitors?
I expected more resistance.
Contact! Multiple armed subjects!
Contact! Armed subject!
Engage and terminate!
Negative. Subject identity confirmed--officer, Republic Army. A valued ally in our battle against tyranny!
Negative. Subjects confirmed as Republic Army personnel--fellow heroes in our war on evil and oppression!
Great. Look, this is a top secret mission. Commander Tavus sent us himself. Does "Havoc Squad Commander Tavus" mean anything to you?
I'm the commander of Havoc Squad. Tavus is a traitor to the Republic.
It means treachery.
This isn't a Republic operation. You're a traitor, just like Tavus.
You're lying.
Tavus isn't the traitor--he was betrayed. And there are some of us who aren't standing for it.
Not interested. Drop those weapons or you're all dead.
Shut up.
Forex, secure the package and follow me. The rest of you, gun this scum down and rendezvous with us at Objective Seven.
Negative! What you suggest is an act of betrayal, the murder of fellow--
M1-4X Override Code Five-Five-Eight! Secure the objective and follow me, now!
Sir, yes, sir!
I am your commanding officer--ignore this man's orders.
Belay that order, M1-4X!
Negative--override code condition five-five-eight. Obey only orders given by Commander Harron Tavus or personnel designated by same.
What's the hurry?
Running won't help.
Let's go! Move, move!
Open fire!
